verbose_text: This could well be correlated with a calcium induced change in the activity of the CBB cycle; however, conclusive evidence for the in vivo role of TKL calcium dependent phosphorylation will have to come from further experimental studies that go beyond the scope of the present study, such as identification of the corresponding kinase or complementation of an Arabidopsis TKL knockout mutant with protein variants that are either non phosphorylatable or mimic permanent phosphorylation.
